pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
I used [Ogre::Matrix4](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_matrix4.html) because [setCustomProjectionMatrix](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_frustum.html#a0413e366f2b5ecaac7e8a1e27e634def) requires a [Ogre::Matrix4](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_matrix4.html) object.

Moving to [ignition::math::Matrix4d](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/99a6af105c966541bba583ce84bf467ec5057890/include/ignition/math/Matrix4.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) in the header would require a conversion before every [setCustomProjectionMatrix](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_frustum.html#a0413e366f2b5ecaac7e8a1e27e634def) call.

And it seems that [ignition::math::Matrix4d](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/99a6af105c966541bba583ce84bf467ec5057890/include/ignition/math/Matrix4.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) doesn't have a function to convert between these two matrix types. So it would need to be done inline or with a new conversion function (which would add the Ogre matrix to the header).

How do you want me to proceed?
content.html:
I used Ogre::Matrix4 because setCustomProjectionMatrix requires a Ogre::Matrix4 object.

Moving to ignition::math::Matrix4d in the header would require a conversion before every setCustomProjectionMatrix call.

And it seems that ignition::math::Matrix4d doesn't have a function to convert between these two matrix types. So it would need to be done inline or with a new conversion function (which would add the Ogre matrix to the header).

How do you want me to proceed?
